title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement clement.claustre@urgences-ara.fr. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Getting-started
text: see vignette rUrgAra can help plotting charge diagram graphs following rUrgAra’s graphical chart.

title: Getting-started
text: exemple shows plot charge diagram using rUrgAra’s plot_diag_charge() table containing entry exit date/times.
code: #Table of entry/exit times head(df_ex_charge) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   ENTREE              SORTIE              Etablissement #>   <dttm>              <dttm>              <chr>         #> 1 2022-01-16 16:14:00 2022-01-16 22:24:41 A             #> 2 2022-01-04 16:12:00 2022-01-04 23:38:01 A             #> 3 2022-01-12 14:18:00 2022-01-12 20:20:26 A             #> 4 2022-01-24 08:25:00 2022-01-24 16:27:53 A             #> 5 2022-01-03 19:08:00 2022-01-04 01:05:40 A             #> 6 2022-01-31 16:09:00 2022-01-31 22:54:14 A #Charge diagram with exclusion of patients staying more than 3 days (72*60 = 4320 minutes) # not taking into account strata  list_charge = plot_diag_charge(data = df_ex_charge, entry = "ENTREE",                                exit = "SORTIE", max_LOS = 72*60) #plot_diag_charge return two objects, a table showing for each hour of # the day how many patient came from what hour (-1 = day before) head(list_charge$tab) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   H_entry  Hour     n n_strata n_days n_avg #>     <dbl> <dbl> <int>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1      -1     1   115        1     32 3.59  #> 2      -1     2    76        1     32 2.38  #> 3      -1     3    57        1     32 1.78  #> 4      -1     4    33        1     32 1.03  #> 5      -1     5    17        1     32 0.531 #> 6      -1     6     5        1     32 0.156 #a charge diagram list_charge$plot #adding a strata to take into account that data are coming from two hospitals list_charge_stratified = plot_diag_charge(data = df_ex_charge, entry = "ENTREE",                                           exit = "SORTIE", strata = "Etablissement",                                           max_LOS = 72*60) #plot_diag_charge return two objects, a table showing for each hour of # the day how many patient came from what hour (-1 = day before) head(list_charge_stratified$tab) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   H_entry  Hour     n n_strata n_days  n_avg #>     <dbl> <dbl> <int>    <int>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1      -1     1   115        2     32 1.80   #> 2      -1     2    76        2     32 1.19   #> 3      -1     3    57        2     32 0.891  #> 4      -1     4    33        2     32 0.516  #> 5      -1     5    17        2     32 0.266  #> 6      -1     6     5        2     32 0.0781 #a charge diagram list_charge_stratified$plot #Limiting the charge diagram to a set period list_charge_stratified = plot_diag_charge(data = df_ex_charge, entry = "ENTREE",                                           exit = "SORTIE", strata = "Etablissement",                                           from = "10/01/2022", to = "20/01/2022",                                           max_LOS = 72*60) #> Warning in plot_diag_charge(data = df_ex_charge, entry = "ENTREE", exit = #> "SORTIE", : 326 rows were removed because they were outside of the studied #> range. list_charge_stratified$plot +    ggplot2::labs(title = "From 10/01/2022 to 20/01/2022") #Hiding the number of entry/exit list_charge_no_lines = plot_diag_charge(data = df_ex_charge, entry = "ENTREE",                                           exit = "SORTIE", strata = "Etablissement",                                           show_lines = FALSE) list_charge_no_lines$plot

what: Adding a company logo to a plot
title: Getting-started
text: exemple shows add company logo (default UrgAra’s) ggplot object.
code: plot_cars = ggplot2::ggplot(cars, ggplot2::aes(x = speed, y = dist)) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   ggpubr::theme_pubclean()  plot_add_logo(plot_cars)#default plot_add_logo(plot_cars, position = "top left")#logo at the top plot_add_logo(plot_cars, width = 0.4)#wider logo

what: Applying rUrgAra palette to a color scale
title: Getting-started
code: plot_iris = ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = Sepal.Length, y =  Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 1.5)  plot_iris#default plot_iris +   ggplot2::scale_color_manual(values = pal_UrgAra()) +#Urg'Ara's color palette   ggpubr::theme_pubclean() +   ggplot2::theme(legend.key = ggplot2::element_blank())

what: Applying rUrgAra palette to a fill scale
title: Getting-started
code: plot_iris_bar = ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = Sepal.Length, y =  Sepal.Width, fill = Species)) +   ggplot2::geom_col()  plot_iris_bar#default plot_iris_bar +   ggplot2::scale_fill_manual(values = pal_UrgAra()) +#Urg'Ara's color palette   ggpubr::theme_pubclean()

what: Applying rUrgAra palette to a dichotomous variable
title: Getting-started
code: plot_iris_dicho = ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = 1, y =  Sepal.Width, fill = Sepal.Length > 5)) +   ggplot2::geom_col()  plot_iris_dicho#default plot_iris_dicho +   ggplot2::scale_fill_manual(values = pal_UrgAra(palette = "duo")) +#Urg'Ara's color palette   ggpubr::theme_pubclean()

title: Getting-started
text: can import template rUrgAra using get_template
code: get_template(template_name = "report", folder = "src/")

code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("https://github.com/Urgences-Ara/rUrgAra", build_vignettes = T)

what: Vérification de la qualité du RPU — check_RPU_quality
title: Vérification de la qualité du RPU — check_RPU_quality
text: Calcule par NOM_ETAB et COD_FIN le taux de remplissage et d'autres informations de diagnostic de la qualité

title: Vérification de la qualité du RPU — check_RPU_quality
code: check_RPU_quality(   tab,   var_hospit = NULL,   var_duree_passage = NULL,   var_age = NULL )

title: Vérification de la qualité du RPU — check_RPU_quality
text: tab Un data.frame ou tibble contenant au minimum "NOM_ETAB" et "COD_FIN". var_hospit Char. Nom de la variable contenant l'hospitalisation. La variable doit être logical var_duree_passage Char. Nom de la variable contenant la durée du passage. La variable doit être numeric var_age Char. Nom de la variable contenant l'age. La variable doit être numeric

title: Vérification de la qualité du RPU — check_RPU_quality
text: liste d'information diagnostic

title: Vérification de la qualité du RPU — check_RPU_quality
text: La fonction explore juste le taux de remplissage d'un tableau par NOM_ETAB/COD_FIN. Le nettoyage de la base (valeurs autorisées) et le calcul de variables composites est à réaliser en amont

title: Vérification de la qualité du RPU — check_RPU_quality
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ #quality_list = check_RPU_quality(RPU, var_hospit = "hospit", #                                 var_duree_passage = "duree_passage", #                                 var_age = "age") #quality_list$n_etab#Nombre d'établissement dans l'export #quality_list$tab_remplissage#taux de remplissage par variable par établissement #quality_list$plot_hospit#Taux d'hospitalisation par établissement #quality_list$plot_duree_passage#boxplot durée de passage par établissement #quality_list$plot_age#boxplot age par établissement } # }

title: FINESS code cleaning — clean_FINESS
text: Adds leading "0" FINESS codes contains 8 caracters instead 9.

code: clean_FINESS(char)

title: FINESS code cleaning — clean_FINESS
text: char character vector containing FINESS codes missing leading "0". code 8 9 characters.

title: FINESS code cleaning — clean_FINESS
text: character vector containing FINESS code leading "0" needed

code: clean_commune(commune, CP = NULL, info = TRUE)

text: commune char character vector containing commune names. CP char character vector containing CP numbers info Boolean print number recoded values

code: library(rUrgAra) clean_commune(c("La tronche", "st-etienne", "Saint     Étienne", "Saint-étienne")) #> 4 communes ont été recodées #> [1] "LA TRONCHE"    "SAINT ETIENNE" "SAINT ETIENNE" "SAINT ETIENNE"

text: Controle values variable

title: Controle values in a variable — fct_format_control
code: fct_format_control(var, val_autor, lab, replacement = "NC")

title: Controle values in a variable — fct_format_control
text: var Variable check val_autor Vector authorized values lab name variable (used print number removed values) replacement Value replace "Non conform" modalities . "NC" used default.

title: Controle values in a variable — fct_format_control
text: vector NA left NA values outside "val_autor" transformed "NC" (conform)

title: Controle values in a variable — fct_format_control
code: var = c(NA, LETTERS[1:5]) fct_format_control(var, val_autor = c("A", "C", "F"), lab = "lettres") #> Warning: 3 formats corrigés pour la variable lettres #> [1] NA   "A"  "NC" "C"  "NC" "NC"

text: Extract template rUrgAra

title: Extract template from rUrgAra — get_template
code: get_template(template_name, folder = ".")

title: Extract template from rUrgAra — get_template
text: template_name template import. Possible values : report folder Folder files corresponding template written.

title: Extract template from rUrgAra — get_template
code: #DO NOT RUN library(rUrgAra) get_template(template_name = "report", folder = "src") #> Warning: cannot create file 'src/empty_report.Rmd', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file 'src/preamble_tex.tex', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file 'src/logo_urgara_minimal.jpg', reason 'No such file or directory' #> [1] "empty_report.Rmd, preamble_tex.tex and logo_urgara_minimal.jpg have been written in src" #> [1] "empty_report assumes that preamble_tex is in the same folder. preamble_tex assumes that logo_urgara_minimal is in ../img" #> [1] "Please, be aware that you need to modify those files or setup your project accordingly."

title: Merge complementary variables — merge_complementary_variables
text: Merges multiple variables mutually exclusive single variables. Use either complete list variables merge prefix variables merge .

title: Merge complementary variables — merge_complementary_variables
code: merge_complementary_variables(   data,   var = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   exclude = NULL,   info = TRUE )

title: Merge complementary variables — merge_complementary_variables
text: data data.frame tibble containing variables merge var char vector containing name variables merge data prefix char vector containing prefix. Every column data starting prefix merged exclude char vector variables exclude merge info Boolean print merged variables number NA console

title: Merge complementary variables — merge_complementary_variables
text: variable containing merged values column

title: Merge complementary variables — merge_complementary_variables
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(rUrgAra) data = data.frame( ID = 1:40, nom_etab01 = c(rep(NA, 30), sample(LETTERS[1:10], 10, replace = TRUE)), nom_etab03 = c(rep(NA, 20), sample(LETTERS[1:10], 10, replace = TRUE), rep(NA, 10)), nom_etab_dechocage = c(rep(NA, 10), sample(LETTERS[1:10], 10, replace = TRUE), rep(NA, 20)), nom_des_etab_du38 =  c(sample(LETTERS[1:10], 10, replace = TRUE), rep(NA, 30)), age =  sample(75:95, 40, replace = T) )  data$etab = merge_complementary_variables(data, prefix = "nom_etab", var = "nom_des_etab_du38",                                           exclude = "nom_etab_dechocage", info = TRUE) data } # }

title: UrgAra color palette — pal_UrgAra

title: UrgAra color palette — pal_UrgAra
code: pal_UrgAra(n = NULL, palette = "main")

title: UrgAra color palette — pal_UrgAra
text: n number colors return palette name palette. information rUrgAra:::UrgAra_palettes

title: UrgAra color palette — pal_UrgAra
text: vector

title: UrgAra color palette — pal_UrgAra
code: library(rUrgAra) library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = factor(cyl))) +   scale_colour_manual(values = pal_UrgAra())

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

what: Add company logo to a plot — plot_add_logo
title: Add company logo to a plot — plot_add_logo
text: Adds company logo (default Urg'Ara) plot. custom logo can used specifying path logo. Optionally data quality indicator can also added

title: Add company logo to a plot — plot_add_logo
code: plot_add_logo(   plot,   logo = NULL,   height = 0.1,   width = 0.2,   height_qual = height * 3/4,   width_qual = width * 3/4,   position = c("bottom right", "bottom", "bottom left", "top right", "top", "top left"),   remove.margin = TRUE,   add_quality = FALSE,   quality_lvl = NULL )

title: Add company logo to a plot — plot_add_logo
text: plot ggplot object logo path image file. NULL, Urg'Ara logo used instead height height logo proportion graph (default 0.1) width width logo proportion graph (default 0.2) height_qual height logo deplaying data quality proportion graph (height/1.33) width_qual width logo proportion graph (width/1.33) position position logo. Possible values "bottom right", "bottom", "bottom left", "top right", "top", "top left". remove.margin margin plot removed side logo precise fit add_quality Boolean : data quality indicator added plot ? position determined automatically quality_lvl numeric : Exhaustivity data used percent (0 100)

title: Add company logo to a plot — plot_add_logo
text: ggplot2 object

title: Add company logo to a plot — plot_add_logo
code: library(rUrgAra) library(ggplot2) plot_cars = ggplot(cars, ggplot2::aes(x = speed, y = dist)) +   geom_point() +   ggpubr::theme_pubclean()  plot_add_logo(plot_cars)#default  plot_add_logo(plot_cars, position = "top left")#logo at the top  plot_add_logo(plot_cars, width = 0.4)#wider logo  plot_add_logo(plot_cars, add_quality = TRUE, quality_lvl = 75)#information on data quality

title: Plot a charge diagram — plot_diag_charge
text: Plot charge diagram table entre datetime exit datetime. charge diagram shows number individuals time arrival hour/half hour day.

title: Plot a charge diagram — plot_diag_charge
code: plot_diag_charge(   data,   entry,   exit,   strata = NULL,   from = NULL,   to = NULL,   max_LOS = Inf,   show_lines = TRUE,   outlier_handling = c("cap", "remove") )

title: Plot a charge diagram — plot_diag_charge
text: data data frame tibble. entry name column containing datetime entry. colmum must class POSIXct character format DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS. exit name column containing datetime exit. colmum must class POSIXct character format DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS. strata name colum(s) containing statas (e.g. structures) average charge . start time frame consider (dmy). Number patients averaged number days "" "" entry date/times truncated "". Default value minimum date entry column. end time frame consider (dmy). Number patients averaged number days "" "" exit date/times truncated "". Default value maximum date exit column. max_LOS Maximum length stay patients minutes. Patients durations longer max_LOS considered missing length stay. show_lines number entry/exit plotted ? Default TRUE. outlier_handling values max_LOS handled. outlier_handling = "cap" (default), values replaced max_LOS. outlier_handling = "remove", values removed

title: Plot a charge diagram — plot_diag_charge
text: list. tab contains table used make charge diagram. H_entry = "-1" patients entered day . plot contains charge diagram.

title: Plot a charge diagram — plot_diag_charge
code: library(rUrgAra) #Table of entry/exit times head(df_ex_charge) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   ENTREE              SORTIE              Etablissement #>   <dttm>              <dttm>              <chr>         #> 1 2022-01-16 16:14:00 2022-01-16 22:24:41 A             #> 2 2022-01-04 16:12:00 2022-01-04 23:38:01 A             #> 3 2022-01-12 14:18:00 2022-01-12 20:20:26 A             #> 4 2022-01-24 08:25:00 2022-01-24 16:27:53 A             #> 5 2022-01-03 19:08:00 2022-01-04 01:05:40 A             #> 6 2022-01-31 16:09:00 2022-01-31 22:54:14 A             #Charge diagram with exclusion of patients staying more than 3 days (72*60 = 4320 minutes) # not taking into account strata list_charge = plot_diag_charge(data = df_ex_charge, entry = "ENTREE",                                exit = "SORTIE", max_LOS = 72*60) #plot_diag_charge return two objects, a table showing for each hour of # the day how many patient came from what hour (-1 = day before) head(list_charge$tab) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   H_entry  Hour     n n_strata n_days n_avg #>     <dbl> <dbl> <int>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1      -1     1   115        1     32 3.59  #> 2      -1     2    76        1     32 2.38  #> 3      -1     3    57        1     32 1.78  #> 4      -1     4    33        1     32 1.03  #> 5      -1     5    17        1     32 0.531 #> 6      -1     6     5        1     32 0.156 #a charge diagram list_charge$plot   #adding a strata to take into account that data are coming from two hospitals list_charge_stratified = plot_diag_charge(data = df_ex_charge, entry = "ENTREE",                                           exit = "SORTIE", strata = "Etablissement",                                           max_LOS = 72*60) #plot_diag_charge return two objects, a table showing for each hour of # the day how many patient came from what hour (-1 = day before) head(list_charge_stratified$tab) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   H_entry  Hour     n n_strata n_days  n_avg #>     <dbl> <dbl> <int>    <int>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1      -1     1   115        2     32 1.80   #> 2      -1     2    76        2     32 1.19   #> 3      -1     3    57        2     32 0.891  #> 4      -1     4    33        2     32 0.516  #> 5      -1     5    17        2     32 0.266  #> 6      -1     6     5        2     32 0.0781 #a charge diagram list_charge_stratified$plot

what: rUrgAra: UrgAra Package For Internal Use — rUrgAra-package
title: rUrgAra: UrgAra Package For Internal Use — rUrgAra-package
text: Package developped facilitate reccurent actions Urg'Ara users. Theses actions include applying graphical chart plots, creating reports plotting charge diagram.

title: rUrgAra: UrgAra Package For Internal Use — rUrgAra-package
text: Maintainer: Clément Claustre clement.claustre@urgences-ara.fr
